text:
MATHEMATICS SCHOOL
Grades 9-12
Mondays, 10:30-10:45
Mathematics School welcomes
back this fall Walter H. Carnahan
and others of Purdue's mathe¬
matics faculty in this series of dis¬
cussions about mathematics.
Mathematics School has been re¬
made to attempt to give a series
of subjects more usable to all high
schools. These programs do not
aim to teach mathematics but
rather to stimulate a live interest
in mathematics study. By giving
ordinarily unknown facts about
the use of mathematics, by putting
an old subject in a new light,
these programs supply a point of
interest not usually provided in
high-school mathematics courses.
This revised schedule of sub¬
jects, with a greater variety of
personalities and the addition of
several new discussions, will
make Mathematics School even
more popular and usable in In¬
diana schools. Professors Walter
H. Carnahan and Carl Holtom de¬
signed and coordinated this ser¬
ies. For free copies of the teach¬
er's manual, use the order blank
on page 15.
